intro: Dracophyllum alticola, commonly known as the alpine draco, is a low-growing shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters and attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dracophyllum alticola plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for alpine wildlife.
